title: [Self-Directed] Medical Device Usability Evaluation Expert Program: Mixed-Methods Application

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding the Medical Device Development Process and Basic Usability Evaluation Methodologies
context.additional_context: Practical skill reinforcement based on real-world medical device development cases for project managers/leaders in corporate settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain step-by-step the medical device usability evaluation process according to EN 62366 standards.
Learners can collect and analyze user experience data using mixed quantitative-qualitative methodologies and derive improvement directions.
Learners can establish interface design strategies to achieve a System Usability Scale (SUS) score of 80 or above.

resources: Medical Device Usability Evaluation Standard Guidelines

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
